definition: that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing

sentences.english: But even that makes insecure Pakistanis jumpy.
sentences.chinese: 但是即使那样也使感觉不安全的巴基斯坦人心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: China is transforming the world as it transforms itself.
sentences.chinese: 中国正在像转变自身那样来转变世界。

sentences.english: Like the rain back in Canada that later turned to sleet.
sentences.chinese: 雨最终转化为雨夹雪，就像在加拿大那样。

sentences.english: Are you like Maggie and George, stuck living in the suburbs?
sentences.chinese: 是否像M和乔治那样，在市郊呆板地生活？

sentences.english: He went about the job like a bull in a china shop.
sentences.chinese: 他干这种活就想公牛进了瓷器店那样莽撞。

sentences.english: As with the Wal-Mart dream, I know better.
sentences.chinese: 就像谁人沃尔玛的梦那样，我就晓得。

sentences.english: The outer rind is so thick and tough that from whatever height it may fall it is never broken.
sentences.chinese: 它的外壳是那样硬，从多高的树上掉下来都不会摔破。

sentences.english: Do not clutter up the page with so many illustrations that you obscure the message.
sentences.chinese: 不要在一页内放置过多的插图，那样会模糊讯息。

sentences.english: The stars are not afraid to appear like fireflies。
sentences.chinese: 群星不怕显得象萤火那样。

sentences.english: Then, the Silk Street will be a good choice.
sentences.chinese: 那样的话，秀水街是个不错的选择。

sentences.english: The earth was as completely cloud-shrouded as normally is the planet Venus.
sentences.chinese: 整个地球就像金星平时那样完全被云雾掩盖着。

sentences.english: We can't behave like people in novels, though, can we?
sentences.chinese: 可是，我们也不能像小说中的人那样啊，对吗？

sentences.english: Would you be like to play so, record my lifetime in television?
sentences.chinese: 你会像电视里演的那样记着我一辈子吗？

sentences.english: It'll make you seem needy as shit.
sentences.chinese: 那样会让你显得很傻帽。

sentences.english: If you serve like Jesus, you can expect to be criticized.
sentences.chinese: 假若你像耶稣那样地服事，必然会受到批评。

sentences.english: He hated the way I called him out.
sentences.chinese: 他其实很讨厌我那样冲他嚷。

definition: to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
that/that kind of/that sort of/that type of
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
